title: American_Top_40_1985_January_26th
description:
"These are the most popular songs in the USA from Sugar City, Colorado, to Sugar Creek, Missouri; from Sugar City, Idaho, to Sugar Creek, Ohio. Up five notches to number 31, here is sweet Sheena Easton with 'Sugar Walls'."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

Casey tells about the song that spent the most amount of time on the hot 100 before entering the top 40, a song about a real life Superman.

The first woman ever to have five top 40 hits from the same album (and the song that did it for her) is in this countdown.

There is a song that is the first (and maybe only) song to make the chart twice in the 80's by 2 different acts.

The talent singing one song in this countdown has an accumulated 218 chart hits.

A lisetner asks, "What acts have had the most hits on the pop chart, on the soul chart, and on the country chart?" Casey says the champ on the pop chart is the King with 139 hits, the Godfather of Soul rules the soul chart with 99 hits, and the man known as the Rolls Royce of Country has had 122 hits on the country chart.

There is an act in the top 10 that regularly got booed off the stage when they opened for The Rolling Stones just 3 years prior.

The number one song of 1952 was also the first record to hit number one on the pop chart and the soul chart. Casey plays a piece of it.
